question.title: JavaFX file does not properly adapt to all screen sizes
question.body:
Hello everyone and thank you in advance. I am currently developping a game and I need to implement the GUI. I decided to use javaFX or more specifically I used JavaFX Scene Builder 2.0 for this, which was already weird because the preview in scenebuilder was always different from what showed up in IntelliJ where I build my project. I made a file for a main lobby and then a file for a game lobby. With the main lobby everything is fine, but the problem is now; For me when I join a game lobby everything is fine and in place like it should be as it is shown in the picture beneath:

But when my friend joins a game lobby everything is stretched and a big part is cut off as shown in this picture:

I already tried to fix this with adapting the size by calculating the screen size but nothing worked and I don't know what is wrong. This is my JavaFX file for the game lobby:

public void switchToGameLobby(String lobbyName) {
        Platform.runLater(() -> {
            try {
                FXMLLoader loader = new FXMLLoader(getClass().getResource("/GameLobbyTemplate.fxml"));
                BorderPane gameLobbyRoot = loader.load();

                GameLobbyController gameLobbyController = loader.getController();
                gameLobbyController.setLobbyName(lobbyName);
                gameLobbyController.setProtocolWriter(protocolWriter);
                client.setGameLobbyController(gameLobbyController);
                gameLobbyController.setClient(client);
                gameLobbyController.setNickname(nickname);
                gameLobbyController.setPrimaryStage(primaryStage);
                // sets the lists
                gameLobbyController.listlist.setItems(listlist.getItems());
                gameLobbyController.gamelist.setItems(gamelist.getItems());
                gameLobbyController.lobbylist.setItems(lobbylist.getItems());

                Scene scene = new Scene(gameLobbyRoot);
                primaryStage.setScene(scene);

                // Gets screen bounds
                Screen screen = Screen.getPrimary();
                Rectangle2D bounds = screen.getVisualBounds();

                // Sets full screen bounds (without fullscreen mode)
                primaryStage.setX(bounds.getMinX());
                primaryStage.setY(bounds.getMinY());
                primaryStage.setWidth(bounds.getWidth());
                primaryStage.setHeight(bounds.getHeight());

                // Bind the root pane to the scene dimensions
                gameLobbyRoot.prefWidthProperty().bind(scene.widthProperty());
                gameLobbyRoot.prefHeightProperty().bind(scene.heightProperty());

                // removes white gap background effect
                scene.setFill(null);

                // Show the window
                primaryStage.show();
            } catch (IOException e) {
                showError("Failed to load the GameLobby" + lobbyName, e.getMessage());
            }
        });
    }

I'd really appreciate it when someone could tell me what's wrong and how I'm able to fix this.

question_comments.body: By the way, you can capture a window by typing Alt-PrtScr, which places an image of the currently focused window on the clipboard.  When you paste it, the result will look much better than taking a photo of a monitor.

I haven't studied your FXML in depth, but I see you're setting the prefWidth and prefHeight properties of various nodes. Typically you should avoid setting the preferred widths and heights of nodes and just let them calculate the values based on their content. Then use the layouts that give you the general "shape" of the UI you want. Let those layouts determine how to resize and reposition their children. Configure the layouts as needed (e.g., padding, spacing, growth priority, etc.). I also recommend avoiding AnchorPane unless you really need it.

"I used JavaFX Scene Builder 2.0" - That's a very old and outdated version. Consider downloading the most recent version from Gluon. The latest version as of this comment is 23.0.1 with 24.0.0 likely to come out some time soon.
